table.caption: 由誰製作或是誰曾打算使用它?
rows: 異怪(Aberration)：該物品由遠古時期的異怪製作，很可能是做給其青睞的類人生物奴康使用。從眼角余光觀察該物品時你會看到它好像在動。
人類(Human)：該物品在某個已隕落的人類王國曾經的全盛時期創造出來，或者它與一名傳奇人類相關。其上可能書寫著某些早已失傳於歷史長河的語法或字符。
天界生物(Celestial)：該武器的重量是普通物品的一半，上面刻著有羽翼、太陽和其他像徵善良的符號。邪廣生物會覺得這件物品的存在令其生厭。
龍類(Dragon)：該物品由龍鱗和龍爪製成。也許它從龍的寶庫中吸收了一些稀有金屈和寶石。當它身處一條龍周圍120呎範圍內時，會變得稍暖一點。
卓爾精靈(Drow)：該物品的重量是普通物品的一半。它通體泛黑，上面刻著蜘蛛和蛛網的圖樣以代表羅絲Lolth。暴露在陽光下1分鐘或更長時間後，其性能可能會因此劣化，或者直接解體。
矮人(Dwarf)：該物品經久耐用，並設計著矮人的符文。它可能與一個希望看到該物品回歸自己先祖大廳的氏族聯繫在一起。
氣元素(Elemental Air)：該物品重量是普通物品的一半，且有一種中空的感覺。如果它是布料製成，則其質感讓人感覺輕盈通透。
土元素(Elemental Earth)：該物品可能由石頭製成。其中任何布料或皮革的部件都讓嵌著精美的磨光岩塊。
火元素(Elemental Fire)：該物品摸起來可以感覺到溫暖，其中任何金展部件都用黑鐵製成。廣符烈烙覆蓋在其表面。紅色和橘色之問的漸變是其主色調。
水元素(Elemental Water)：潤澤魚鱗取代該物品的皮革或布料部件，而由海貝製成的金屬部件硬度跟真金風一樣堅韌。
精靈(Elf)：該物品重量是普通物品的一半。其上裝飾著自然的象徵:樹葉，藤蔓，星星，等等。
精類生物(Fey)：該物品用最好材料精心製作而成，它在月光下會發出淡淡的光耀，並想周邊5呎半徑範圍散發出微光光照。其所有金用部件都有白銀和秘銀來代替原來鐵和鋼。
邪魔(Fiend)：該物品用黑鐵或角刻上符文製作而成，其所有布質或皮質部件都由邪魔的毛皮製作，它的表面觸感暖和，其上裝飾著斜脫的面孔或邪穢的符文。天界生物會覺得該物品令其感覺厭惡。
巨人(Giant)：該物品比普通物品要大，由巨人為其身材細小的盟友們精心製作而成。
地侏(Gnome)：該物品看起來很普通，甚至感覺有點破舊。它可以和一些齒輪和機械部件結合起來，不過這些部件對物品本身的功能沒什麼影響。
不死生物(Undead)：該物品包含了死亡的意象（比如骨頭和頭骨），它可能由屍體的殘骸製成的。且摸起來可以感覺到冰冷。

table.caption: 過去是否有一些小細節?
rows: 奧秘(Arcane)：該物品由遠古的施法者團體創造，並帶著該團體的象徵符號。
禍根(Bane)：該物品由某個特定文明或某種生物的敵人創造。如果該文明或生物仍然存在，則他們可能會認出這個物品，並將其持有者視為敵人。
英雄(Heroic)：一位偉大的英雄曾持用該物品。任何熟悉該物品曾經歷史的人都期待著其新主人的偉大事蹟。
修飾(Ornament)：該物品為紀念一個特殊的場合而製作。它鋃嵌著寶石、黃金或鉑金，並以金銀裝飾其表面。
預言(Prophecy)：該物品顯現一則預言:它的持有者註定要在未來的事件中扮演關鍵角色。那些想要扮演該角色的人可能會試圖竊取該物品，或者想阻止該預言被實現的人會想要殺死這個物品的持有者。
宗教(Religious)：該物品曾被用於宗教儀式，並專門用於某個特定的神只。其內還有神聖的符文正在生效。該神靈的追隨者們可能會試圖說服其主人將它捐贈給神廟，或者私自將其竊取，或者向同屬於該神隻的牧師或聖騎士持用者表示祝賀。
罪惡(Sinister)：該物品與某個重大惡行相關，比如大居殺或暗殺。它可能有一個名字，或者與一個曾使用它的反派密切相關。任何熟悉該物品過去的人都可能對其所有者表示懷疑。
權力象徵(Symbol of Power)：該物品曾被用作皇室高階官職加冕物品的一部分。它的前主人或那個人的後代可能會想要得到該物品，或者有人可能會誤以為它的新主人是該物品的合法繼承人。

table.caption: 有哪些小得益
rows: 燈塔(Beacon)：持有者可以用一個附贈動作，使物品在 10呎半徑範圍內散發出明亮光照以及其外 10呎微光光照，或以同樣的動作熄滅這些光照。
指南針(Compass)：持用者可以用一個動作得知哪邊是北方。
良識(Conscientious)：該物品的持有者考慮或進行惡意行為時，該物品會增加良心的痛苦。
探索者(Delver)：在地底時，該物品的持有者總能知道物品在地表以下的深度，以及最近的樓梯、斜坡或其他向上道路的方位。
閃亮(Gleaming)：該物品永遠不會變髒。
警衛(Guardian)：該物品會低語對持有人發出警告，如果持有人並未陷入無力，則其獲得先攻 +2 加值。
和諧(Harmonious)：與該物品完成同調只須1分鐘。
隱秘情報(Hidden Message)：一則情報被隱藏在該物品的某個位置。它可能在一年中的某一時刻，月亮的某一月相，或在特定地點時才能看見。
鑰匙(Key)：該物品被用來解鎖一個容器、房間、地窖或其他入口。
語言(Languages)：持有人可以在該物品在身邊時理解或講說一種由 DM 選定的語言。
哨兵(Sentinel)：選擇一個生物類型，並將其設定為該物品製作者的敵人。當同類生物在物品周邊120呎範圍內時，物品將散發出微光。
歌唱(Song Craft)：每當該物品被打到或被用來打擊敵人時，它的持有者就會聽到一首古老歌曲的片段。
奇異材質(Strange Material)：該物品由一種很奇怪的材料製成，但這並不影響其耐用性。
溫度(Temperate)：持有者身處如 -20華氏度或120華氏度的溫度下，不會受到任何冷熱環境造成的傷害。
牢不可破(unbreakable)：該物品無法被破壞。必須用一些特殊手段才能將其摧毀。
戰爭領袖(War Leader)：持有人可以用一個動作使自己的聲音清晰地傳遞至遠300呎距離，效應持續至該持有人自己的下一回合結束。
水性(Waterborne)：該物品漂浮在水上和其他液體上。它的持有者以力量(運動)檢定進行游泳時具有優勢。
惡意(Wicked)：當持有人有機會以自私或惡意的方式行事時，該物品會使持有人的衝動變得更加強烈。
幻術(Illusion)：該物品充滿了幻術魔法，可以讓其持有人微小的改變該物品的外觀。這樣的改變不會改變該物品著裝、攜帶或使用的方式，也不會對其別的魔法屬性產生影響。例如，其著裝者可以讓紅色的長袍看起來是藍色，或者讓金色的戒指看起來是像牙質。當沒有人攜帶或著裝該物品時，它就會恢復其真實的外觀。
骰兩次，每次遇到骰值20時重骰。

table.caption: 有哪些小習性
rows: 極樂(Bissful)：擁有該物品時，持有人將感覺未來充滿幸運與樂觀。蝴蝶和其他無害的生物可能會在物品出現時在其周圍嬉戲。
自信(Confident)：該物品幫助其持有者感到自信。
貪婪(Covetous)：該物品的持有者會沉迷於物質財富。
脆弱(Frail)：該物品被持用、著裝或激活時，會發生輕微的破碎、磨損、崩口或炸裂。這種小習性對其屬性沒有影響，但該物品被用的越多就會顯得越破舊。

大喊(Loud)：使用該物品時，它會發出響亮的聲音(好比一聲鏗鏘、一聲喊叫或一聲共振)。
變質(Metamorphic)：該物品會周期性隨機地細微改變其外觀。持有人無法控制這些小改動，這些改​​變也不影響物品的使用效果。
呢喃低語(Muttering)：該物品牢騷不斷，喃喃自語。一個仔細聆聽的生物可能從中得知一些有用的東西。
痛苦(Painful)：使用該物品時，持有者會經歷一種無害的疼痛。
佔有(Possessive)：該物品需要同調，且第一次持用或著裝該物品後，它便不允許其持有者再與其他物品進行同調。 (已經與持有人完成同調的物品維持其同調狀態，直至其同調聯結終止。)
反感(Repulsive)：與該物品接觸時，其持有人會感到一種厭惡感，並且會持續感覺到這種不舒服的感覺。
懶惰(Slothful)：該物品的持有者感覺懶散且昏昏欲睡。與此同時，持有者需要花費 10 小時才能完成一次長休。

rows: {@bold Lose an Eye.} You have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on ranged attack rolls. Magic such as the {@spell regenerate} spell can restore the lost eye. If you have no eyes left after sustaining this injury, you're {@condition blinded}.

{@bold Lose an Arm or a Hand.} You can no longer hold anything with two hands, and you can hold only a single object at a time. Magic such as the {@spell regenerate} spell can restore the lost appendage.

{@bold Lose a Foot or Leg.} Your speed on foot is halved, and you must use a cane or crutch to move unless you have a peg leg or other prosthesis. You fall {@condition prone} after using the Dash action. You have disadvantage on Dexterity checks made to balance. Magic such as the {@spell regenerate} spell can restore the lost appendage.

{@bold Limp.} Your speed on foot is reduced by 5 feet. You must make a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw after using the Dash action. If you fail the save, you fall {@condition prone}. Magical healing removes the limp.

{@bold Internal Injury.} Whenever you attempt an action in combat, you must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, you lose your action and can't use reactions until the start of your next turn. The injury heals if you receive magical healing or if you spend ten days doing nothing but resting.
{@bold Broken Ribs.} This has the same effect as Internal Injury above, except that the save DC is 10.

{@bold Horrible Scar.} You are disfigured to the extent that the wound can't be easily concealed. You have disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks and advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as {@spell heal} 和 {@spell regenerate}, removes the scar.

{@bold Festering Wound.} Your hit point maximum is reduced by 1 every 24 hours the wound persists. If your hit point maximum drops to 0, you die. The wound heals if you receive magical healing. Alternatively, someone can tend to the wound and make a DC 15 Wisdom (Medicine) check once every 24 hours. After ten successes, the wound heals.
{@bold Minor Scar.} The scar doesn't have any adverse effect. Magical healing of 6th level or higher, such as {@spell heal} 和 {@spell regenerate}, removes the scar.

table.caption: Giant Personality Traits
rows: The brutality of my peers is a relic of a bygone era that should be stamped out. I seek a more enlightened path.
As the most powerful beings in creation, we have a duty to use our strength for the benefit of all.
I take what I want. I don't care who gets hurt.
A giant lives for a few centuries, but giantkind is eternal. Everything I do is to glorify my ancestors and make my descendants proud.
Dragons are my mortal enemies. Everything I do is to ensure their destruction.
I measure a creature's worth by its size. The small folk are beneath my concern.
The small folk are vermin. I enjoy torturing and killing them.
Good or bad, Annam's sons represent the ideals that we, as giants, must strive to uphold.
table.name: Roleplaying a Giant; Giant Personality Traits

table.caption: Giant Ideals
rows: The Ordning. Annam created the ordning for the good of all giants, and it's our duty to uphold his vision. (Lawful)
Skill. What sets my clan apart is its mastery of our traditional crafts. (Good)
Strength. No other race can match the strength of giants, and none should dare to try. (Evil)
Lordship. Giants are the rightful rulers of the world. All will be well when our empire is restored. (Neutral)
Tribute. The lesser races owe giants not just respect but payment of tribute, and what they don't pay willingly, we will take by force. (Chaotic)
Religion. Of Annam's many sons, none is greater than my patron deity. (Any)
table.name: Roleplaying a Giant; Giant Ideals

table.caption: Giant Bonds
rows: My clan is the most important influence on my life, our collective place in the ordning depends on our devotion to one another.
My clan mates who serve in our deity's temples are the closest companions I'll ever know.
My place in the ordning is ordained by our patron deity, and it would be blasphemous to aspire to anything higher or lower.
Though I can never rise above my clan's position in the ordning, I can be a leader among my clan.
My own kind have turned their backs on me, so I make my way among the lesser creatures of the world.
Humans have proven their worth in the world and earned a measure of respect from giantkind.
table.name: Roleplaying a Giant; Giant Bonds

table.caption: Giant Flaws
rows: The ordning is too restrictive for the likes of me.
The lesser creatures of the world have no souls
Unity among giants is a myth, anyone not of my clan is a fair target for my weapons.
I care nothing for what others expect, to the point where I cannot help but contradict what others ask of me.
I am terrified of arcane magic and can be cowed by overt displays of it.
Ancient dragons fill me with dread. My knees grow weak in their presence.
table.name: Roleplaying a Giant; Giant Flaws

I always act unpleasant so others never learn of my secret affections.
I enjoy wagers as parts of my bargains, which increase the risk and the stakes.
I laugh at my own jokes-the darker, the better.
I never volunteer information, and I respond only to questions.
I offer generous terms in my deals, but the cost for defaulting is exceedingly high.
I require all of my bargains to be put in writing and signed in the other party's blood.
I am very superstitious, and I see omens in every event and action around me.

table.caption: Hag Ideals
rows: Change. I will metamorphose into every kind of hag and live a century as each, becoming something even greater in the end. (Chaotic)
Community. Loneliness is the path to madness. That is why I have minions to keep me company. (Lawful)
Greed. I will acquire the rarest and most valuable holy treasures to keep them from being used for good. (Evil)
Independence. I neither require nor want a coven. I will not be someone's equal. (Neutral)
Power. I will become an auntie or a grandmother, even if I have to kill my own mother to do it. (Evil)
Ugliness. I want to be envied for my appearance and my cruel heart. (Evil)
table.name: Roleplaying a Hag; Hag Ideals

table.caption: Hag Bonds
rows: I hate a certain mortal family and steal one of their children each generation for my own purposes.
I am involved in a centuries-long feud with a rival of similar power and status.
My house holds everything that I hold dear. I can't abide visitors who threaten my hearth and home.
I owe a great favor to a hag grandmother.
I traded away something before I realized it was priceless, and now I want it back.
My daughter was taken from me, and I want to find her and train her.
My greatest rival and I know a secret word that will destroy both of us simultaneously.
The ones who looted and burned my home will pay for their offense.
table.name: Roleplaying a Hag; Hag Bonds

I am greatly weakened on the nights of the full moon.
I can't resist a clever riddle.

Savagery. I will not be controlled. (Chaotic)
table.name: Roleplaying an Orc; Orc Ideals

I owe my survival to a non-orc.

table.caption: Unusual Demon Features
rows: Belches Flies. Once per day, the demon can use an action to belch enough flies to create an effect as though it cast fog cloud.

Ever-Open Extra Eye. The demon gains advantage on Perception checks related to sight.

Bleeds Wasps. The first time in each combat the demon is reduced to half its hit points or less, a swarm of insects (wasps) forms around it. The swarm considers creatures other than the demon to be enemies.
Extra Arm. The demon gains advantage on Sleight of Hand checks.
Enormous Ears. The demon gains advantage on Perception checks to hear sounds.
Silver Bones. The demon's natural weapons are considered silvered.
Snake Hair. Creatures that grapple the demon or are grappled by it are poisoned until the grapple ends.
Endlessly Mumbling Second Mouth. The demon suffers disadvantage on Stealth checks against creatures that can hear.
Huge Feet. The demon suffers disadvantage on Stealth, Athletics, and Acrobatics checks when they involve moving its feet.
Translucent Skin. The demon's skin is slimy and translucent. It has advantage on attempts to escape a grapple.
Oily Boils. Each time the demon takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, the area within 5 feet of it becomes difficult terrain until the end of the demon's next turn.
Thick Lead Skull. The demon can't use telepathy or be contacted by telepathy. It can't be charmed, frightened, or stunned.
Worm Tongue. The demon can't speak any language.
Head Hands. The demon has heads where its hands should be and uses the heads' mouths to manipulate objects. If the demon had claw attacks, they become bite attacks that deal piercing damage.
Blimp Body. The demon can float at will as if under the effect of the levitate spell (no concentration required). While it has half its hit points or less, it loses this ability.
Immaterial. The demon has resistance to all damage except psychic damage, and all damage it deals is halved.
Long Arms. The demon's reach is 5 feet longer than normal.
Eyeless. The demon is blind. It has blindsight with a radius of 60 feet.
Vestigial Demon. A miniature vestigial twin of the demon grows from its body. The demon can't be blinded, deafened, or stunned.

table.caption: Githyanki Personality Traits
rows: When I'm bored I make my own excitement, and I'm always bored.
I treat others as if they were animals that simply don't know any better.
Violence is a spice that makes life worth living.
Old age is a concept that I find fascinating. Maybe someday I too will be aged.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githyanki Personality Traits

table.caption: Githyanki Ideals
rows: Fidelity. Warriors are only as good as the vows they keep.
Power. The weak rule the strong.
Duty. It is by Vlaakith's will alone that I act.
Freedom. No strong soul should be enslaved. Better to die first than live as another's puppet.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githyanki Ideals

table.caption: Githyanki Bonds
rows: There is no greater duty than to serve the Revered Queen.
Humanity thrives only because we conquered the illithids. Therefore, what is theirs is ours.
Without battle, life has no purpose.
Life is but a spark in the dark. We all go dark, but those who dare can burn bright.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githyanki Bonds

table.caption: Githyanki Flaws
rows: Hunger and thirst are unbearable pains to me.
I can't see a non-githyanki as a real threat.
I follow orders, regardless of their implications.
I start projects but never finish them.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githyanki Flaws

table.caption: Githzerai Personality Traits
rows: All energy must be expended to a useful end. Frivolity is the first step to defeat.
Patience in all things. The first step in any venture is the most treacherous.
Emotions are a trap, meant to weaken the intellect and disturb the nerves. Pay them no heed.
Begin only those tasks you will finish. Strike only that which you will kill.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githzerai Personality Traits

table.caption: Githzerai Ideals
rows: Faith. Zerthimon shall return, and I will be worthy to walk beside him.
Courage. The mind can master anything if it is unfettered by fear.
Duty. My people survive only because those like me place their needs above our own.
Freedom. No strong soul should be enslaved. Better to die first than live as another's puppet.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githzerai Ideals

table.caption: Githzerai Bonds
rows: Zerthimon provides an example of conduct that I strive to duplicate.
Menyar-Ag hand-picked me for my duties, and I will never betray the trust he showed in me.
Vlaakith and her toadies will be defeated, if not by me then by those who follow in my footsteps.
I will not rest until the last elder brain is destroyed.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githzerai Bonds

table.caption: Githzerai Flaws
rows: I see githyanki machinations behind every threat.
I believe in the supremacy of the gith and that githzerai and githyanki will align to rule the multiverse.
I respond to even minor threats with overwhelming displays of force.
The next time I laugh will be the first. The sound of merriment takes me to the edge of violence.
table.name: Gith Tables; Githzerai Flaws

table.caption: Halfling Personality Traits
rows: You try to start every day with a smile.
Why walk when you can skip?
You make up songs about your friends that praise them for their bravery and intelligence.
You are extremely cautious, always on the lookout for monsters and other dangers.
You always see the bright side of a situation.
You like to collect mementos of your travels.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Personality Traits

table.caption: Halfling Ideals
rows: Courage. You seek to prove that the bravest heart can be contained within the smallest of packages.
Companionship. You're pretty sure you can be friends with anyone or anything.
Hopeful. You will live a life of adventure and have many stories to tell.
Protective. You make sure to shelter the innocent.
Honest. Your mother told you to always tell the truth.
Excitement. Can you steal the sleeping giant's pouch? Of course you can!
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Ideals

table.caption: Halfling Bonds
rows: The safety of your village is worth any sacrifice.
Nothing is more valuable than friendship and family.
You are following your own path through life. No one can tell you what to do.
You have a special heirloom that you never part with.
You won't rob or hurt those who are weaker or less fortunate than you.
No matter how small you may be, you won't back down from a bully.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Bonds

table.caption: Halfling Flaws
rows: You can't resist poking your nose where it doesn't belong.
You are very fidgety. Sitting still is a major challenge.
You can't pass up a good time.
You hate to miss a meal, and become grumpy and ill­tempered when you must.
You are fascinated by shiny things and can't help "borrowing" them.
You never settle for just one slice when you can have the whole cake.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Halfling Flaws

table.caption: Reasons for Adventuring
rows: Peeling taters and herding goats all the time wasn't your cup of tea.
You fell asleep on a raft one day and woke up near a human city. You were so thrilled with the strange sights and tasty food that you never turned back.
What started off as simple pumpkin pillaging from nearby farms turned into your becoming a wandering rogue for hire.
You talked to a nice faerie in the woods, and all of a sudden you were a thousand miles from home.
Your village elder told you so many stories about being a rogue in an adventuring party that you couldn't resist the urge to try doing it yourself.
A friend dared you to jump on the back of a sleeping horse, which turned out to be a pegasus, and your life hasn't slowed down since.
table.name: Halfling Tables; Reasons for Adventuring

table.caption: Gnome Personality Traits
rows: Once you develop a liking for something, you quickly become obsessed with it.
You live life like a leaf on the breeze, letting it take you where it will.
The world is a miraculous place, and you are fascinated by everything in it.
You study your friends and take notes about how they act, jotting down things they say that interest you.
Your curiosity is so wide-ranging that you sometimes have trouble concentrating on any one thing.
You like to make little objects and creatures out of twigs or bits of metal and give them to friends.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Personality Traits

table.caption: Gnome Ideals
rows: Love. You love little (and big) critters and go out of your way to help them.
Curiosity. You can't stand an unsolved mystery or an unopened door.
Knowledge. You are interested in everything. You never know when what you learn will come in handy.
Compassion. You never turn down a plea for help.
Helpfulness. Whether you see a broken contraption or a broken heart, you have to try to fix it.
Excellence. You strive to be and do the best you can.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Ideals

table.caption: Gnome Bonds
rows: You pledge to bring something of immense value back to your burrow.
Anything of great quality and artisanship is to be protected, respected, and cared for.
Kobolds have caused you and your people nothing but trouble. You will avenge those wrongs.
You are searching for your lost love.
You will recover a keepsake stolen from your clan.
You are willing to take risks to learn about the world.
table.name: Gnome Tables; Gnome Bonds

table.caption: Gnome Flaws

You prefer to hide during a fight.
There is no difference between what you think and what you say.

rows: "Oh, dear! Did you hear all that commotion yesterday evening near the opera house? It appears that a couple of dignitaries went missing during the performance."

"A most dreadful moaning was coming from the plaza today. My friend said she saw a wailing spirit floating over the park. I wish they'd stay in the bank."
"Such a commotion at the Wayfinder Club last night. I heard the fight, but a friend told me there were blades drawn, and the perpetrator escaped!"
"Can you believe the gall of some people? I saw a couple of dirty ruffians in my neighborhood last night, and they were defacing the walls of the courthouse!"
"I still can't believe that crazy old Orzhov syndic just handing out zinos near the plaza, muttering 'The end is near.' She'll invite nothing but undesirables sniffing for free coin."

... threaten a character's contact or bond.
... challenge a character's ideal or exploit a flaw. The character might hear rumors of this activity, spurring them into action.
... open an opportunity for a character to pursue a personal goal.
... compete with a character's guild. A guild authority might order the character to rectify the situation.
... open an opportunity for a guild to pursue its own agenda.
... catch the characters between fighting forces.
... cause an accident or catastrophe that traps the characters.
table.name: Involving the Characters; Cross Purposes

table.caption: Secondary Guild Role
rows: A rival pursues the same goal as the adventurers, but is doing it "wrong."
One or more members of another guild are caught between the villain and the adventurers.
A group of NPC adventurers from another guild confront the same villain for different reasons.
Someone is manipulating the villain for their own purposes.
A known rival or enemy meddles in the adventure, hoping the adventurers will fail.
A known rival or enemy can provide essential help in stopping the villain.
A second villain's plot is unfolding at the same time but is otherwise unrelated.
A second villain is in competition with the first one.
table.name: Complications; Secondary Guild Role

table.caption: Guild Intrigue
rows: Guilds are vying for influence over a prominent individual (who might be a player character).
Guilds are competing for control of a key site or swath of territory.
Guilds are locked in a deadly feud but might be open to a peace negotiation.
Villains from two or more guilds are forming a dangerous alliance.
A villain is trying to disrupt an alliance between two or more guilds.
Splinter factions from two guilds are trying to form a new guild.
table.name: Guild Intrigue

table.caption: Arrester Station Adventures
rows: Break out of the holding cells.
Break someone else out of the holding cells.
Stop someone before they can give information to the arresters or testify before a judge.
Get information from or to someone in the holding cells.
Apprehend a former prisoner who used magic to take over the station and drive the guards away.
Find proof that the captain of this station is corrupt.
Discover who helped a prisoner escape and how.
Uncover a plot to discredit, blackmail, or kill the station commander.
Steal the arresters' files about a criminal or a case.
Intercept a message being sent to or from the station.
table.name: Arrester Station Adventures

table.caption: Azorius Villains
rows: An ambitious authority figure seeks to achieve a higher rank by framing or defaming a rival.
A venal judge's rulings are swayed by bribes and favors.
A vengeful imperator persecutes a certain group of people, seeking revenge for a past wrong done by one of the group's members.
An overzealous imperator is prepared to arrest a neighborhood full of people to find a stolen item.
A sadistic warden tortures prisoners, ostensibly for the sake of law and order.
A corrupt senator seeks to pass laws that favor a certain class of people.
A {@creature precognitive mage|GGR} invents visions designed to frame enemies.
A cowardly bureaucrat destroys evidence to hide someone else's involvement in a crime.
table.name: Azorius Villains

table.caption: Azorius Assignments
rows: Find and arrest a wanted fugitive.
Arrest someone identified as a potential criminal by precognitive mages.
Clear the name of an innocent person.
Solve a murder by questioning suspects.
table.name: Azorius Character Goals; Azorius Assignments

table.caption: Azorius Adventure Hooks
rows: A {@creature precognitive mage|GGR} has identified the characters as future criminals, and now there's a warrant out for their arrest.
A {@creature precognitive mage|GGR} has foreseen the characters' future struggles and tries to protect them, thereby interfering in their next adventure.
{@creature Felidar|GGR|Felidars} have bonded with the wrong person and now track an innocent citizen.
Hussars—Azorius {@creature Soldier|GGR|soldiers}  mounted on {@creature Griffon|MM|griffons}—declare martial law in a neighborhood and enforce their harsh authority on the citizenry.
An {@creature archon of the Triumvirate|GGR} interprets innocent actions as illegal ones because its connection to the law has been corrupted.
A missing {@creature homunculus} is the sole witness to the murder of a judge.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Azorius Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Legion Garrison Adventures
rows: Break a siege at the garrison.
Sabotage the building's defenses so someone else can break into the garrison.
Find a hidden explosive charge in the garrison before it detonates.
Steal a magic weapon held inside the garrison.
Discover evidence that incriminates an officer in the garrison.
Identify a spy among the garrison's soldiers before the spy can escape.
Help a spy get safely out of the garrison without being discovered.
Capture a garrison officer for interrogation.
Shore up the garrison's defenses before an assault.
Clear out the monsters infesting a garrison that was abandoned years ago.
Steal plans for future Boros military action.
table.name: Legion Garrison Adventures

table.caption: Boros Villains
rows: Seeking to avenge a partner's murder, a Wojek League officer turns to vigilantism.
A Boros commander starts preemptively closing Izzet foundries, Simic research chambers, and other locations considered prone to disaster.
Angered at the death of a loved one in a certain neighborhood, a Wojek agent is inciting its residents to revolt, knowing that the Boros will respond with force.
Believing that they are harboring terrorists, a Boros brigadier is slaughtering helpless people in transient communities in the undercity.
A squad of corrupt Boros {@creature Soldier|GGR|soldiers}  is extorting money from local merchants.
A Boros commander under the thumb of another guild is turning a blind eye to the violence perpetrated by that guild.
An overzealous angel has risen up against innocent people, including the soldiers in her own garrison, believing that they harbor evil in their hearts.
A crazed angel demands to be worshiped as a god.
table.name: Boros Villains

table.caption: Boros Assignments
rows: Help quell a Rakdos riot or hold back Gruul raiders, or otherwise maintain the peace while protecting innocent bystanders.
Capture or kill a Gruul chieftain who has taken responsibility for a series of brutal raids.
Help evacuate citizens from the area of a natural or magical disaster.
Escort an important person safely from one place to another.
Investigate a Boros commander suspected of cultivating personal loyalty in underlings, rather than loyalty to the legion.
Uncover a spy in the legion.
table.name: Boros Character Goals; Boros Assignments

table.caption: Boros Adventure Hooks
rows: A Boros officer is awaiting trial for unsanctioned and excessive use of force, and the officer's squad is planning a jailbreak.
The Boros are secretly working with the Shattergang Brothers, a group of black market arms dealers, to develop a devastating weapon.
A Boros offensive is displacing and even killing innocent bystanders caught in its path.
Flame-kin soldiers created as part of an abandoned weapons project are suddenly reactivated and run amok. These soldiers use the {@creature azer} stat block in the {@book Monster Manual|MM}.
A Boros parade meant as a show of strength provokes widespread protests, some of which erupt into violence.
A flying Boros fortress is about to crash, threatening to devastate the neighborhood below.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Boros Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Safe House Adventures
rows: Find a fugitive hiding in the safe house.
Liberate someone being held in the safe house.
Get information from a prisoner in the safe house without revealing that information to the Dimir.
Acquire information from a Dimir agent to unmask a spy embedded in another guild.
Escape from captivity in the safe house.
Plant a magical surveillance device inside the safe house.
Damage or destroy the safe house so the Dimir can't use it anymore.

Prevent the creation of a horror (a {@creature flying horror|ggr}, {@creature shadow horror|ggr}, or a {@creature skittering horror|ggr}) in the safe house. (You can replace the horror with a different creature from the {@book Monster Manual|MM}.)
Find and kill a {@creature mind drinker vampire|GGR} or other monster that is picking off the safe house's inhabitants.
Disable the safe house's wards and plant a beacon inside it so that members of another guild can find and raid the place.
After stumbling into the safe house accidentally, get out with memories intact.
table.name: Safe House Adventures

table.caption: Dimir Villains
rows: A spy seeks to plunder another guild's secrets.
A {@creature mind mage|GGR} is hunting down everyone who witnessed a great humiliation to expunge their memories of the event.
A {@creature mind mage|GGR} has implanted false memories of a crime in many minds in order to incriminate someone.
A group of Dimir agents is plundering the minds of people who have knowledge of a vault that holds great wealth or magical power.
After a Dimir spy is unmasked, a {@creature mind mage|GGR} erases the memory of the spy's identity from the minds of those involved.
A shapeshifter has replaced a high-ranking member of another guild in order to provoke conflicts.
A {@creature mind drinker vampire|GGR} is plundering the minds of its victims.
Roll on another guild's villain table, but the villain is a disguised Dimir agent or someone being manipulated by the Dimir.
table.name: Dimir Villains

table.caption: Dimir Assignments
rows: Impersonate an individual to gather information from that individual's contacts and associates.
Make sure that a particular person (not a main antagonist) at an adventure site doesn't survive the encounter with the characters.
Make sure that a particular person (not the main villain) survives the adventure.
Get information from the main villain by magically extracting the villain's dying thoughts.
Plant evidence to steer the other adventurers away from the true villain.
Get information to a Dimir agent who is embedded in the adventure location.
table.name: Dimir Character Goals; Dimir Assignments

table.caption: Dimir Adventure Hooks
rows: The characters find a bundle of {@i thought strands}, and Dimir agents are in a rush to find them before they fade away.
A rogue agent hunted by Dimir assassins offers crippling information about House Dimir in exchange for protection.
A Dimir horror (a {@creature flying horror|ggr}, {@creature shadow horror|ggr}, or a {@creature skittering horror|ggr}) is randomly killing people in the dark alleys of a particular neighborhood.
Word is out that someone claims to have a list of Dimir agents embedded in other guilds, igniting a furious contest to obtain the list.
While prying too deeply into ancient lore, a Dimir agent (now deceased) released a nameless evil into the city.
Roll on another guild's adventure hooks table, but the Dimir are secretly behind the situation.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Dimir Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Undercity Mansion Adventures
rows: Find the source of a noxious fog rising from the undercity and poisoning a surface neighborhood.
Rescue several citizens being held hostage by Ochran agents.
Find the daytime lair of an elusive monster that hunts on the surface at night.
Rescue a guild member {@condition petrified} by an {@creature undercity medusa|GGR} that uses the mansion as its lair.
Take shelter in the mansion to escape a horrible monster prowling the undercity.
Win a bet by surviving a night inside.
Find and claim a treasure hidden in the mansion.
Attend a masked ball held in the mansion in order to get information from another guest.
table.name: Undercity Mansion Adventures

table.caption: Golgari Villains
rows: Armed with a powerful magic item found among the dead in the undercity, a {@creature Golgari shaman|GGR} enacts a plan of revenge against another guild.
A {@creature kraul death priest|GGR} is seeking a way to revive the ancient gods of Ravnica and destroy the world.
A {@creature Devkarin lich|GGR} is capturing living subjects and infecting them with an insidious, mind-controlling fungus.
A trophy-hunting {@creature undercity medusa|GGR} for the stat block) is on a killing spree, petrifying victims in interesting poses.
A {@creature Golgari shaman|GGR} is spreading a fungal infection that transforms its dead victims into {@creature Zombie|MM|zombies}.
An elf child lures citizens into the sewers, where a monstrous "pet" is waiting to kill and eat them.
Pursuing a personal vendetta, an Ochran {@creature assassin} is targeting members of a certain guild and trying to ensure that their bodies are never found.

A {@creature kraul death priest|GGR}, angry at the way the Golgari have treated the kraul in the past, is killing the elves and medusas of the guild, hoping to eventually take Jarad's place as guildmaster.
table.name: Golgari Villains

table.caption: Golgari Assignments
rows: Find a valuable item believed lost in the undercity.
Retrieve a corpse in the undercity.
Collect a sample of a fungus in the undercity.
Steal something that is important to another guild.
Kill an outspoken enemy of the Golgari.
Position a fungus so that its spores will spread into a populated area and drive the inhabitants out.
table.name: Golgari Character Goals; Golgari Assignments

table.caption: Golgari Adventure Hooks
rows: Citizens who die in a particular neighborhood sprout fungal growths and rise as {@creature Zombie|MM|zombies}, then shamble toward the undercity.
{@creature Swarm of Insects|MM|Swarms of insects} under the control of a {@creature Golgari shaman|GGR} terrorize a neighborhood.
Poor people who subsist on Golgari food contract a dangerous, contagious magical infection.
Several kraul have moved into an old tenement and are making their neighbors nervous.
A beloved statue, long assumed to be the image of some forgotten community hero, suddenly returns to life after being {@condition petrified} for a hundred years.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Golgari Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Rubblebelt Encampment Adventures
rows: Determine why the Gruul have camped so close to a settled neighborhood.
Free a captive taken in a recent raid.
Win freedom by defeating a Gruul champion in a duel.
Retrieve something looted in a recent raid.
Strike a deal with the Gruul leader to cooperate against a common foe.
Attempt to overthrow the clan chieftain in a combat challenge.
Strike a blow to the Gruul to ensure that they don't launch a raid.
Free a corralled herd of violent beasts so they stampede through the Gruul camp before the Gruul can steer them toward settled areas.
Interrupt a ritual intended to summon or create a huge elemental.
Disrupt a gathering of clans that could lead to an alliance between them.
table.name: Rubblebelt Encampment Adventures

table.caption: Gruul Villains
rows: A {@creature druid of the Old Ways|GGR}, spurred by visions of the end of civilization, plans humanoid sacrifices in the name of Ilharg the Raze-Boar.
A druid is directing herds of beasts to run amok through tenement neighborhoods.
A druid summons huge vines and roots to tear buildings down.
A clan chieftain leads a raid to settle a personal vendetta against another guild.
In a display of strength, a clan chieftain seeks to destroy a significant landmark.
Looking for a totem of spiritual significance, a clanless giant wrecks anything in its path.
Hoping to form a new clan, a clever centaur tries to break violent criminals out of jail.
A druid leads a band that has begun starting fires around the district.
table.name: Gruul Villains

table.caption: Gruul Assignments
rows: Collect a beast cub so it can be trained for battle.
Slay a powerful monster to prove your strength.
Destroy a laboratory, a work of engineering, or a similar edifice of decadent civilization.
Kill someone who has been persecuting the Gruul.
Free a captive warrior who was imprisoned during a recent raid.
Create a disruption so the clan can raid elsewhere.
table.name: Gruul Character Goals; Gruul Assignments

table.caption: Gruul Adventure Hooks
rows: Conflict between two feuding clans spills onto the streets of the city, threatening to destroy entire neighborhoods.
Gruul {@creature Anarch|GGR|anarchs} deface or destroy monuments throughout the district.
A Gruul mob riots in the streets in observance of Rauck-Chauv, a holiday celebrated with violence.
A {@creature wurm|GGR} breaks free of its Gruul controller and goes on a rampage.
Swine everywhere run wild, and the Gruul interpret this as a sign of the Raze-Boar's return.
Gruul raiders steal something from an Izzet laboratory that will cause a disaster if it isn't returned.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Gruul Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Experimental Workshop Adventures
rows: Rescue people trapped in the workshop after a disaster.
Steal plans or a prototype for a new weapon.
Stop the spread of toxic gas or molten mizzium from inside the workshop.
Shut down the operation of a dangerous device.

Capture or kill an elemental or an Izzet weird (a {@creature blistercoil weird|ggr} or {@creature galvanice weird|ggr}) that is running amok in the workshop, and make sure it doesn't escape out into the city.
Get out of the workshop before it is destroyed by a spreading catastrophe.
Destroy the workshop in order to obliterate the research being done there.
Destroy the workshop in order to bring down a different building nearby.
Find a saboteur in the workshop before the traitor's plans can be enacted.
Kill an inventor whose ideas are too dangerous to be put into practice.
Activate an invention being held in storage in the workshop.
table.name: Experimental Workshop Adventures

table.caption: Bizarre Magical Effects
rows: Every spell cast in the area triggers a wild magic surge. (Roll on the Wild Magic Surge table in the "Sorcerer" section of the {@i Player's Handbook}.)
One or more objects in the area have a random trick effect. (Roll on the Tricks table in {@book appendix A|DMG|10|Random Tricks} of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}.)
The area is affected by a {@spell guards and wards}{@i  spell}.
Rooms and chambers in the area are affected by random obstacles. (Roll on the Obstacles table in {@book appendix A|DMG|10|Stocking a Dungeon} of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}.)
One or more objects in the area have a random trap effect. (Roll on the Traps table in {@book appendix A|DMG|10|Random Traps} of the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|DMG}.)
Random sections of the area are affected by an {@i anti­magic field} spell.
table.name: Experimental Workshop Map; Bizarre Magical Effects

table.caption: Izzet Villains
rows: A disgraced member of the Izmundi tries to embarrass the guild by orchestrating a magical disaster.
A team of inventors is creating a secret arsenal of volatile weapons.
Trying to impress the guildmaster, a mage from the Laboratory of Storms and Electricity creates a device that pushes the weather from one extreme to another.
A researcher siphons power from the Blistercoils to fuel experiments, causing failures in parts of the city's infrastructure.
An obsessive researcher, trying to perfect an alchemical formula, causes a series of ever-worsening laboratory mishaps.
A guild leader orchestrates a series of "accidental" laboratory explosions that are actually meant to disrupt the nearby activities of other guilds.
An imprisoned spellcaster stages an explosive prison break using improvised materials.
A suspicious spellcaster who can't trust research secrets to others creates clones that run amok.
table.name: Izzet Villains

table.caption: Izzet Assignments
rows: Acquire a hard-to-find metal or energy source.
Take measurements of an unusual object or location (such as spatial dimensions or readings of various magical levels).
Repair an important piece of Ravnica's infrastructure, such as a water main or a boiler pipe, that is tucked away in a remote location.
table.name: Izzet Character Goals; Izzet Assignments

table.caption: Izzet Adventure Hooks
rows: An Izzet experiment transforms a researcher, who then seeks help in returning to normal form.
An escaped Izzet weird (a {@creature blistercoil weird|ggr} or {@creature galvanice weird|ggr}) is causing magical malfunctions around the district.
A researcher trying to craft an antigravity alloy for a personal flight apparatus has created a number of {@spell reverse gravity} effects, and is now trapped in midair at the top of one.
After a laboratory explosion, an alchemical fire resistant to conventional firefighting techniques is spreading through several neighborhoods.
A reckless researcher triggered an explosion in a mizzium foundry, causing a wave of molten metal to spill out into the surrounding streets.
A researcher who claims to have traveled back in time warns of an impending disaster.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Izzet Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Grand Basilica Adventures
rows: Steal (or recover) a magic item from the vaults below the basilica.
Put an end to nightly visitations by finding and confronting the haunting spirit in the basilica.
Survive a night trapped inside the basilica.
Deliver a warning to an Orzhov pontiff in the basilica and get out alive.
Rescue a prisoner being held in the basilica's spire or crypts.
Escape from captivity in the basilica's spire or crypts.
Destroy a dangerous weapon stored in a vault beneath the basilica.
Acquire or destroy some incriminating evidence held by an Orzhov blackmailer.
Retrieve a precious item held as collateral by an Orzhov loan shark.
Get information from a spirit who knew something important in life.
Find concrete evidence of the syndicate's illegal activities.
Discover the fate of someone who was last seen entering the basilica a week ago.
table.name: Grand Basilica Adventures

table.caption: Orzhov Villains
rows: A powerful pontiff is using the spirits of dead relatives to intimidate members of other guilds.
An angel defected from the Boros Legion, bringing a magic sword with her that the Boros want back.
An Orzhov knight is trying to collect an overdue debt incurred by one of the adventurers' ancestors.
A pontiff is running an extortion racket, promising local businesses protection from thugs that are also in the Orzhov's employ.
A {@creature blood drinker vampire|GGR} is holding prisoners as a food supply in a bank vault.
An advokist is exploiting legal loopholes to win the freedom of several criminals from Azorius prisons.
A desperate spirit tries to frighten people into paying its debts so it can pass on.
An unusually quick-witted {@creature Orzhov giant|GGR} for the stat block) with grand visions of starting a criminal gang interferes with the flow of protection money.
table.name: Orzhov Villains

table.caption: Orzhov Assignments
rows: Convince a debtor to make a payment.
Damage the person or property of someone who refuses to pay protection money.
Transport a chest of coins to an Orzhov bank.
Destroy evidence that implicates the Orzhov in a crime.
Find information that can be used to blackmail a powerful person.
table.name: Orzhov Character Goals; Orzhov Assignments

table.caption: Orzhov Adventure Hooks
rows: Newly minted Orzhov coins are inscribed with a magical symbol that binds the spirit of anyone who uses them.
{@creature Indentured Spirit|GGR|Indentured spirits} have been deployed to haunt a location the Orzhov want to keep people away from.
Thrulls (a {@creature servitor thrull|ggr} or {@creature winged thrull|ggr}) that have broken free of Orzhov control are causing mischief.
Items appear on the black market that were obviously stolen from an Orzhov vault, but no one admits that the theft has occurred or claims credit.
{@creature Gargoyle|MM|Gargoyles} perched on structures throughout the city are robbing passersby and delivering their stolen goods to an Orzhov basilica.
An eclipse triggers violent behavior from bound Orzhov spirits.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Orzhov Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Notorious Nightclub Adventures
rows: Shut down a performance before the performers start attacking the crowd.
Escape from the club once the violence starts.
Protect a thrill seeker who wants to witness a performance close up.
Rescue someone who has been abducted for use as an extra in a show.
Find evidence that someone important was (or was not) killed in a previous performance here.
Capture a performer who ran away from a prominent family to "join the circus."
Use the distraction of a performance to hold a secret meeting with someone from another guild.
Spy on someone who is using the distraction of a performance to hold a secret meeting.
Acquire a magic item the Rakdos are using as part of a performance.
Investigate rumors that the Rakdos have a wingless angel in their show.
Find an escaped convict who is rumored to be hiding behind Rakdos makeup.
Stop a Rakdos member who is blackmailing an important person with embarrassing information.
table.name: Notorious Nightclub Adventures

table.caption: Rakdos Villains
rows: A coven of {@creature Blood Witch|GGR|blood witches}, seeking Rakdos's favor, uses magic to turn members of other guilds against their own allies.
Word spreads that a retiring performer wants to go out with a bang, and their final performance promises to be explosive.
Mocking the absence of the Guildpact, a Rakdos troupe takes over the Chamber of the Guildpact and performs its satire before a captive audience.
A demon captures people and makes a game of thwarting their efforts to escape.
A skilled puppeteer uses skeletal marionettes to recreate historical acts of violence between guilds—which are inexplicably repeated in the real world within the next few days.
A ringmaster has discovered magic that fills the whole audience with blood lust and sends them rampaging through the streets.
A hypnotist is programming audience members to go into a murderous rage when a triggering event occurs.
A crazed {@creature blood witch|GGR} hopes to rouse Rakdos by driving captured sacrificial victims into his lair.
table.name: Rakdos Villains

table.caption: Rakdos Assignments
rows: Acquire a flashy magic item to use as a prop in a performance.
Try out a new performance routine in the midst of actual life-or-death combat.
Sow distrust of an important person through satire or slander.
Make sure a specific person is in the front row for a certain performance.
Capture a deadly monster for use in a spectacular show.
Interrupt a solemn ceremony or ritual being performed by another guild.
table.name: Rakdos Character Goals; Rakdos Assignments

table.caption: Rakdos Adventure Hooks
rows: Wild-eyed people attending a popular new club seem unwilling or unable to go home after several days of nonstop merriment.
One morning, everyone who has seen a Rakdos performance in the past week suddenly transforms into a minor demon.
An apparently spontaneous Rakdos-led riot has spread to take over an entire neighborhood.
People who die in Rakdos-inspired violence stand back up as {@creature Zombie|MM|zombies} and keep fighting.
Ordinary knives and chains in homes across the neighborhood seem to come to life in advance of the start of a Rakdos show.
After several mausoleums are burst open from the inside, people see their undead family members cavorting on a Rakdos stage.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Rakdos Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Vernadi Center Adventures
rows: Ascertain the numbers of the military forces housed in and around the vernadi.
Find the source of pollen that is drifting through the neighborhood and making people placid and compliant.
Find the source of wind-borne seeds that are drifting through the neighborhood and quickly growing into hostile awakened shrubs.
Retrieve an initiate who was supposedly forced to join the guild through mind-affecting magic.
Stop the vernadi, whose tree has awakened and escaped the control of its dryad, from trampling through the neighborhood.
Find a way to tap into the mind, will, and knowledge of Mat'Selesnya through the vernadi's central tree or its dryad.
Introduce a contagion into Mat'Selesnya through the vernadi's tree or its dryad.
Capture an equenaut who has been accused of a crime and who has taken refuge at the vernadi.
Convince or coerce a healer to tend to a sick or wounded person who would normally be an enemy of the conclave.
Find a spy embedded in the vernadi community.
Blend into the community to avoid pursuers.
Retrieve an item that was donated to the community by a new initiate, but without the permission of the item's owner.
table.name: Vernadi Center Adventures

table.caption: Selesnya Villains
rows: A fanatical leader disrupts building projects because they aren't in harmony with nature.
A Ledev guardian is leading preemptive raids on other guilds, believing that a full-scale attack on the conclave is imminent.
A voda, feeling imperiled by the ills of society, causes vines to grow and seal the members of her vernadi inside.
A militant leader of a splinter group harasses "unbelievers" on the street and threatens to unleash elemental power on them.
A loxodon evangel uses coercive methods to recruit young people into the conclave.
An elf seeking spiritual union with Mat'Selesnya threatens the dryad of their own vernadi.
A crazed prophet claims to be the incarnation of Mat'Selesnya and gathers an army to strike at other guilds.
A {@creature horncaller|GGR} steals animals that were used as pets, mounts, and beasts of burden throughout the neighborhood.
table.name: Selesnya Villains

table.caption: Selesnya Assignments
rows: Work to stop the spread of a strange illness.
Tend to the victims of a catastrophe or an attack.
Mediate a dispute between two other guilds.
Plant a magic seed, watch it grow into a great tree, and defend the tree until reinforcements arrive.
Bring an unruly beast under control and return it to the vernadi it escaped from.
Lead a targeted military strike to warn another guild against overreaching.
table.name: Selesnya Character Goals; Selesnya Assignments

table.caption: Selesnya Adventure Hooks
rows: A sacred tree has been defiled or cut down, and an angry Selesnya mob is gathering to exact revenge.
The Worldsoul has identified the characters as emblematic of their guilds' overreaching ambition.
A seer of the conclave tries to convince the characters that they are fated to save the world.
Plants throughout a neighborhood develop carnivorous tendencies.
A magic-infused stone of a Selesnya building grows out of control, threatening nearby buildings.
A Selesnya {@creature wurm|GGR} breaks free of its controller and goes on a rampage.
table.name: Other Adventure Hooks; Selesnya Adventure Hooks

table.caption: Growth Chamber Adventures
rows: Escape from the chamber while a {@creature category 3 krasis|GGR} runs amok through it after breaking out of its growth pod.
Break one or more krasis out of their growth pods in order to wreak havoc on the growth chamber.
Stop a sinister experiment in progress.
Spy on a research program intended to create superior soldiers.
Subtly sabotage a research program so that it fails without the interference being obvious.
Steal research notes from an experiment with broad applications.
Free someone who has become the involuntary subject of Simic experiments.
Discover the source of a form of terraforming magic spreading out from the chamber's location.
Capture a crazed Simic scientist who is trying to use other scientists in the chamber for experimental subjects.
Capture a crazed Simic scientist whose own body has been drastically altered by their experiments.
Acquire the laboratory's technology so it can be put to use by another guild.
Retrieve research notes from a flooded and abandoned laboratory.
table.name: Growth Chamber Adventures

table.caption: Simic Villains
rows: A rogue researcher is flooding parts of the undercity to serve as aquariums for secret experiments.
Researchers are capturing members of the other guilds so they can create hybrid soldiers that take advantage of the weaknesses of those guilds.
Researchers team up to surround an entire neighborhood in a plasma casing that is slowly altering the environment and all its inhabitants.
A magic-wielding Simic hybrid is eluding capture by the authorities thanks to a combination of adaptations and spells.
A researcher delves too deep into ancient lore and discovers mind-warping alien secrets.
A researcher creates a moss that threatens to destroy much of the city's food production.

tables.caption: Gnoll/Cultist Physical Features
rows: Weapon still embedded in old wound

tables.caption: Gnoll/Cultist Personality Trait
rows: Once an enemy defies me, I dedicate everything to its destruction.
The best enemy to fight is one caught by surprise.
I hate the sun and travel only by night.
I have stopped using language and instead rely on growls and shrieks.
I have no fear of death and welcome it in battle.
My berserk fury makes a rabid dog look gentle.

tables.caption: Gnoll/Cultist Ideals
rows: Strength. I must remain strong to survive. (Any)
Slaughter. If I destroy the weak, I please Yeenoghu. (Evil)
Destruction. Yeenoghu will return when only those worthy of his fury remain. (Evil)
Paranoia. Others are planning to kill and eat me. I must find a way to kill and eat them first. (Chaotic)
Self-Sufficiency. When the time comes, even my allies will die by my hand. (Evil)
Leadership. I am not part of the pack. I am above it. (Chaotic)

tables.caption: Gnoll/Cultist Bonds
rows: I would die before betraying the Lord of Savagery.
I would follow the leader of our war band anywhere and gladly sacrifice myself to protect him or her.
I cull the weak from our war band, so that we remain strong.
Yeenoghu's omens guide my every choice.
If I die in battle, I was simply too weak to please Yeenoghu.
I devour the weak to purge them from the world, the strong to blunt their power.

tables.caption: Gnoll/Cultist Flaws
rows: I lack tactical guile and rely on overwhelming attacks.
I flee from opponents that can match my strength.
My supposed allies are my first victims.
Deep down inside, I am terrified I will fail Yeenoghu.
My desire to torment my foes sometimes gives them the opportunity to outwit me.
My arrogance causes me to overlook opportunities.

tables.caption: Acolyte
rows: I ran away from home at an early age and found refuge in a temple.
My family gave me to a temple, since they were unable or unwilling to care for me.
I grew up in a household with strong religious convictions. Entering the service of one or more gods seemed natural.
An impassioned sermon struck a chord deep in my soul and moved me to serve the faith.
I followed a childhood friend, a respected acquaintance, or someone I loved into religious service.
After encountering a true servant of the gods, I was so inspired that I immediately entered the service of a religious group.

tables.caption: Charlatan
rows: I was left to my own devices, and my knack for manipulating others helped me survive.
I learned early on that people are gullible and easy to exploit.
I often got in trouble, but I managed to talk my way out of it every time.
I took up with a confidence artist, from whom I learned my craft.
After a charlatan fleeced my family, I decided to learn the trade so I would never be fooled by such deception again.
I was poor or I feared becoming poor, so I learned the tricks I needed to keep myself out of poverty.

tables.caption: Criminal
rows: I resented authority in my younger days and saw a life of crime as the best way to fight against tyranny and oppression.
Necessity forced me to take up the life, since it was the only way I could survive.
I fell in with a gang of reprobates and ne'er-do-wells, and I learned my specialty from them.
A parent or relative taught me my criminal specialty to prepare me for the family business.
I left home and found a place in a thieves' guild or some other criminal organization.
I was always bored, so I turned to crime to pass the time and discovered I was quite good at it.

tables.caption: Entertainer
rows: Members of my family made ends meet by performing, so it was fitting for me to follow their example.
I always had a keen insight into other people, enough so that I could make them laugh or cry with my stories or songs.
I ran away from home to follow a minstrel troupe.
I saw a bard perform once, and I knew from that moment on what I was born to do.
I earned coin by performing on street corners and eventually made a name for myself.
A traveling entertainer took me in and taught me the trade.

tables.caption: Folk Hero
colLabels: I became a folk hero because...
rows: I learned what was right and wrong from my family.
I was always enamored by tales of heroes and wished I could be something more than ordinary.
I hated my mundane life, so when it was time for someone to step up and do the right thing, I took my chance.
A parent or one of my relatives was an adventurer, and I was inspired by that person's courage.
A mad old hermit spoke a prophecy when I was born, saying that I would accomplish great things.
I have always stood up for those who are weaker than I am.

tables.caption: Guild Artisan
colLabels: I became a guild artisan because...
rows: I was apprenticed to a master who taught me the guild's business.
I helped a guild artisan keep a secret or complete a task, and in return I was taken on as an apprentice.
One of my family members who belonged to the guild made a place for me.
I was always good with my hands, so I took the opportunity to learn a trade.
I wanted to get away from my home situation and start a new life.
I learned the essentials of my craft from a mentor but had to join the guild to finish my training.

tables.caption: Hermit
rows: My enemies ruined my reputation, and I fled to the wilds to avoid further disparagement.
I am comfortable with being isolated, as I seek inner peace.
I never liked the people I called my friends, so it was easy for me to strike out on my own.
I felt compelled to forsake my past, but did so with great reluctance, and sometimes I regret making that decision.
I lost everything-my home, my family, my friends. Going it alone was all I could do.
Society's decadence disgusted me, so I decided to leave it behind.

tables.caption: Noble
rows: I come from an old and storied family, and it fell to me to preserve the family name.
My family has been disgraced, and I intend to clear our name.
My family recently came by its title, and that elevation thrust us into a new and strange world.
My family has a title, but none of my ancestors have distinguished themselves since we gained it.
My family is filled with remarkable people. I hope to live up to their example.
I hope to increase my family's power and influence.

tables.caption: Outlander
rows: I spent a lot of time in the wilderness as a youngster, and I came to love that way of life.
From a young age, I couldn't abide the stink of the cities and preferred to spend my time in nature.
I came to understand the darkness that lurks in the wilds, and I vowed to combat it.
My people lived on the edges of civilization, and I learned the methods of survival from my family.
After a tragedy I retreated to the wilderness, leaving my old life behind.
My family moved away from civilization, and I learned to adapt to my new environment.

tables.caption: Sage
rows: I was naturally curious, so I packed up and went to a university to learn more about the world.
My mentor's teachings opened my mind to new possibilities in that field of study.
I was always an avid reader, and I learned much about my favorite topic on my own.
I discovered an old library and pored over the texts I found there. That experience awakened a hunger for more knowledge.
I impressed a wizard who told me I was squandering my talents and should seek out an education to take advantage of my gifts.
One of my parents or a relative gave me a basic education that whetted my appetite, and I left home to build on what I had learned.

tables.caption: Sailor
rows: I was press-ganged by pirates and forced to serve on their ship until I finally escaped.
I wanted to see the world, so I signed on as a deck-hand for a merchant ship.
One of my relatives was a sailor who took me to sea.
I needed to escape my community quickly, so I stowed away on a ship. When the crew found me, I was forced to work for my passage.
Reavers attacked my community, so I found refuge on a ship until I could seek vengeance.
I had few prospects where I was living, so I left to find my fortune elsewhere.

tables.caption: Soldier
rows: I joined the militia to help protect my community from monsters.
A relative of mine was a soldier, and I wanted to carry on the family tradition.
The local lord forced me to enlist in the army.
War ravaged my homeland while I was growing up. Fighting was the only life I ever knew.
I wanted fame and fortune, so I joined a mercenary company, selling my sword to the highest bidder.
Invaders attacked my homeland. It was my duty to take up arms in defense of my people.

tables.caption: Urchin
rows: Wanderlust caused me to leave my family to see the world. I look after myself.
I ran away from a bad situation at home and made my own way in the world.
Monsters wiped out my village, and I was the sole survivor. I had to find a way to survive.
A notorious thief looked after me and other orphans, and we spied and stole to earn our keep.
One day I woke up on the streets, alone and hungry, with no memory of my early childhood.
My parents died, leaving no one to look after me. I raised myself.

tables.caption: Barbarian
rows: My devotion to my people lifted me in battle, making me powerful and dangerous.
The spirits of my ancestors called on me to carry out a great task.
I lost control in battle one day, and it was as if something else was manipulating my body, forcing it to kill every foe I could reach.
I went on a spiritual journey to find myself and instead found a spirit animal to guide, protect, and inspire me.
I was struck by lightning and lived. Afterward, I found a new strength within me that let me push beyond my limitations.
My anger needed to be channeled into battle, or I risked becoming an indiscriminate killer.

tables.caption: Bard
rows: I awakened my latent bardic abilities through trial and error.
I was a gifted performer and attracted the attention of a master bard who schooled me in the old techniques.
I joined a loose society of scholars and orators to learn new techniques of performance and magic.
I felt a calling to recount the deeds of champions and heroes, to bring them alive in song and story.
I joined one of the great colleges to learn old lore, the secrets of magic, and the art of performance.
I picked up a musical instrument one day and instantly discovered that I could play it.

tables.caption: Cleric
rows: A supernatural being in service to the gods called me to become a divine agent in the world.
I saw the injustice and horror in the world and felt moved to take a stand against them.
My god gave me an unmistakable sign. I dropped everything to serve the divine.
Although I was always devout, it wasn't until I completed a pilgrimage that I knew my true calling.
I used to serve in my religion's bureaucracy but found I needed to work in the world, to bring the message of my faith to the darkest corners of the land.
I realize that my god works through me, and I do as commanded, even though I don't know why I was chosen to serve.

tables.caption: Druid
rows: I saw too much devastation in the wild places, too much of nature's splendor ruined by the despoilers. I joined a circle of druids to fight back against the enemies of nature.
I found a place among a group of druids after I fled a catastrophe.
I have always had an affinity for animals, so I explored my talent to see how I could best use it.
I befriended a druid and was moved by druidic teachings. I decided to follow my friend's guidance and give something back to the world.
While I was growing up, I saw spirits all around me-entities no one else could perceive. I sought out the druids to help me understand the visions and communicate with these beings.
I have always felt disgust for creatures of unnatural origin. For this reason, I immersed myself in the study of the druidic mysteries and became a champion of the natural order.

tables.caption: Fighter
rows: I wanted to hone my combat skills, and so I joined a war college.
I squired for a knight who taught me how to fight, care for a steed, and conduct myself with honor. I decided to take up that path for myself.
Horrible monsters descended on my community, killing someone I loved. I took up arms to destroy those creatures and others of a similar nature.
I joined the army and learned how to fight as part of a group.
I grew up fighting, and I refined my talents by defending myself against people who crossed me.
I could always pick up just about any weapon and know how to use it effectively.

tables.caption: Monk
rows: I was chosen to study at a secluded monastery. There, I was taught the fundamental techniques required to eventually master a tradition.
I sought instruction to gain a deeper understanding of existence and my place in the world.
I stumbled into a portal to the Shadowfell and took refuge in a strange monastery, where I learned how to defend myself against the forces of darkness.
I was overwhelmed with grief after losing someone close to me, and I sought the advice of philosophers to help me cope with my loss.
I could feel that a special sort of power lay within me, so I sought out those who could help me call it forth and master it.
I was wild and undisciplined as a youngster, but then I realized the error of my ways. I applied to a monastery and became a monk as a way to live a life of discipline.

tables.caption: Paladin
rows: A fantastical being appeared before me and called on me to undertake a holy quest.
One of my ancestors left a holy quest unfulfilled, so I intend to finish that work.
The world is a dark and terrible place. I decided to serve as a beacon of light shining out against the gathering shadows.
I served as a paladin's squire, learning all I needed to swear my own sacred oath.
Evil must be opposed on all fronts. I feel compelled to seek out wickedness and purge it from the world.
Becoming a paladin was a natural consequence of my unwavering faith. In taking my vows, I became the holy sword of my religion.

tables.caption: Ranger
rows: I found purpose while I honed my hunting skills by bringing down dangerous animals at the edge of civilization.
I always had a way with animals, able to calm them with a soothing word and a touch.
I suffer from terrible wanderlust, so being a ranger gave me a reason not to remain in one place for too long.
I have seen what happens when the monsters come out from the dark. I took it upon myself to become the first line of defense against the evils that lie beyond civilization's borders.
I met a grizzled ranger who taught me woodcraft and the secrets of the wild lands.
I served in an army, learning the precepts of my profession while blazing trails and scouting enemy encampments.

tables.caption: Rogue
rows: I've always been nimble and quick of wit, so I decided to use those talents to help me make my way in the world.
An assassin or a thief wronged me, so I focused my training on mastering the skills of my enemy to better combat foes of that sort.
An experienced rogue saw something in me and taught me several useful tricks.
I decided to turn my natural lucky streak into the basis of a career, though I still realize that improving my skills is essential.
I took up with a group of ruffians who showed me how to get what I want through sneakiness rather than direct confrontation.
I'm a sucker for a shiny bauble or a sack of coins, as long as I can get my hands on it without risking life and limb.

tables.caption: Sorcerer
rows: When I was born, all the water in the house froze solid, the milk spoiled, or all the iron turned to copper. My family is convinced that this event was a harbinger of stranger things to come for me.
I suffered a terrible emotional or physical strain, which brought forth my latent magical power. I have fought to control it ever since.
My immediate family never spoke of my ancestors, and when I asked, they would change the subject. It wasn't until I started displaying strange talents that the full truth of my heritage came out.
When a monster threatened one of my friends, I became filled with anxiety. I lashed out instinctively and blasted the wretched thing with a force that came from within me.
Sensing something special in me, a stranger taught me how to control my gift.
After I escaped from a magical conflagration, I realized that though I was unharmed, I was not unchanged. I began to exhibit unusual abilities that I am just beginning to understand.

tables.caption: Warlock
rows: While wandering around in a forbidden place, I encountered an otherworldly being that offered to enter into a pact with me.
I was examining a strange tome I found in an abandoned library when the entity that would become my patron suddenly appeared before me.
I stumbled into the clutches of my patron after I accidentally stepped through a magical doorway.
When I was faced with a terrible crisis, I prayed to any being who would listen, and the creature that answered became my patron.
My future patron visited me in my dreams and offered great power in exchange for my service.
One of my ancestors had a pact with my patron, so that entity was determined to bind me to the same agreement.

tables.caption: Wizard
rows: An old wizard chose me from among several candidates to serve an apprenticeship.
When I became lost in a forest, a hedge wizard found me, took me in, and taught me the rudiments of magic.
I grew up listening to tales of great wizards and knew I wanted to follow their path. I strove to be accepted at an academy of magic and succeeded.
One of my relatives was an accomplished wizard who decided I was smart enough to learn the craft.
While exploring an old tomb, library, or temple, I found a spellbook. I was immediately driven to learn all I could about becoming a wizard.
I was a prodigy who demonstrated mastery of the arcane arts at an early age. When I became old enough to set out on my own, I did so to learn more magic and expand my power.

tables.caption: Devil Personality Traits
rows: I always have a scheme to make a profit.
Nobody is as smart as me, and I need to prove that all the time.
If I can't seize control, I'll serve in the meantime.
I'm a bully who backs down when faced with any sort of resistance.
Every problem can be solved with the use of force.

tables.caption: Devil Ideals
rows: Loyalty. I keep my vows to my superior and respect those who do the same.
Law. I might not like the rules, but I obey them.
Ambition. The need to improve my station drives my every action.
Conquest. I am equal to the sum of the foes I have defeated in combat.
Cunning. Those who can see an advantage in the direst situation deserve respect.
Brutality. Overwhelming violence, and those who can deliver it, are worthy of obedience.

tables.caption: Devil Bonds
rows: I and my comrades fought well in the Blood War, and our service demands respect.
Evil without law is a pointless exercise in destruction. Rules make us what we are.
Those who follow me rely on my wisdom to ensure their prosperity.
One day I will have revenge on those who defied me.
If I do my duty, in time I will be rewarded.
We don't corrupt mortals. We teach them enlightened self-interest.

tables.caption: Devil Flaws
rows: My frustration boils over into violence.
I obey the law, but I strain at its limits to the point of heresy.
I put the minimum effort possible into anything that isn't my own idea.
A low profile is the best defense of all.
I'm so reliant on the laws of the Nine Hells that I panic without their guidance.
I am secretly jealous of the freedom that mortals enjoy.
